qas.question: When did the Liberian economy hit it's peak growth?
Why did the Liberian economy decline after 1980?
By what percentage did Liberia's GDP reduced by during the civil war?
Why was Liberia's GDP growth stalled in 2007?
In 2011 Liberia's economy was considered what?

answers.text: one of the 20 fastest growing in the world.

qas.question: When did the Liberian economy reach peak timber exports?
Why was Liberia's GDP growth stalled prior to 2007?

plausible_answers.text: one of the 20 fastest growing in the world

qas.question: In 2011 Liberia's exports were considered what?
When was the GDP reduced by 95%?
In what year did GDP growth reach 5.1%?

context: Following a peak in growth in <a0_0><b5_0>1979<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the Liberian economy began a steady decline due to <a1_0>economic mismanagement following the 1980 coup.<a1_0/> This decline was accelerated by the outbreak of civil war in 1989; GDP was reduced by an estimated <a2_0>90%<a2_0/> <b8_0>between 1989 and 1995<b8_0/>, one of the fastest declines in history. Upon the end of the war in 2003, GDP growth began to accelerate, reaching 9.4% in 2007. <a3_0><b6_0>The global financial crisis<b6_0/><a3_0/> slowed GDP growth to 4.6% in 2009, though a strengthening agricultural sector led by rubber and timber exports increased growth to 5.1% in <b9_0>2010<b9_0/> and an expected 7.3% in 2011, making the economy <a4_0><b7_0>one of the 20 fastest growing in the world<b7_0/>.
